column5: Especially these cool mukluks I picked up on the way back from the Sutton.
I would think those boots are a different strain than Bills!!!! lol.Sure look warm Mike .
Mike say its not so , you flossed those boots with a marshmallow ... Lol nice boots , alot prettier than Bills ,
I like them Mike. Nothing like a hand made pair of mukluks.
awesome   ....i used to have a pair similar to those in the 80s...i still wear mukluks today (moose hyde} but not as high as those...can your feet breath in these ones? What are they made from?
Tanned chinook hide.
LMAO HAHAHAHA , cup of coffe all over key board ...
:rofl2: That wasnt nice,while I was having a swig. Went up my nose.Dang that hurts.
Mike stop fleecing chinooks.  On second thought, at least you used the body after you squeezed the roe...
I used to wear them too Mike, but much lower than yours, course it was about a gazillion years ago....1959  I'm the funny looking kid on your right with the axe at my throat
What a great picture Lew.
Hey surprise surprise, something truly worthwhile actually came of this post.  Great picture Lew, thanks for posting.
That's my Dad and brother with me at the family deer camp north of Barry's Bay.  Sorry for the hijack Mike
Yep thats you Lew,  I can tell that smile anywhere
Really nice boots Mike, next time you go up there can you grab me a pair.  Love them   And Lew, that is an awesome picture of you, your dad and bro.  Really cool!!
That pic Lew posted isn't from National Geographic?    :)
Waaaaaay back when that picture was taken Bill, I don't think National Geographic had been invented yet
Wore a pair like that (minus the fur) through high school. Mind you I did listen to A LOT of Ted Nugent
A pic of Lew smiling!!!! BTW, nice boots, they'll keep your feet nice and toasty.
